data.question: What is the main motivation for synthesizing porous coordination framework materials?
data.answer: The incorporation of diverse chemical and physical properties, including multiple properties within one material.

data.question: What unique feature does the material [Fe(NCS)2(bpbd)2]·{acetone} offer?
data.answer: It offers potential host-host and host-guest hydrogen-bonding interactions provided by the diol functional groups of the ligand.

data.question: How were single crystals of A·{ac} grown?
data.answer: By slow diffusion in acetone.

data.question: What causes the spin transition in A·{ac} to be more abrupt compared to other frameworks?
data.answer: The enhanced cooperativity between the iron(II) centers conferred by the network of interframework hydrogen-bonding interactions.

data.question: True or False: The guest acetone molecules participate in short hydrogen-bonding interactions with the diol groups from the bpbd ligands.
data.answer: False

data.question: What happens to the unit-cell volume of A·{ac} over the course of the spin transition?
data.answer: There is an overall decrease in the unit-cell volume of approximately 4%.

data.question: What is the effect of desorption of acetone on the spin-crossover behavior of A·{ac}?
data.answer: The spin-crossover behavior remains remarkably similar, with a slight decrease in the temperature of the transition.

data.question: True or False: The structural motif of the material changes over the spin transition from high-spin to low-spin states.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the role of interframework hydrogen-bonding interactions in A·{ac}?
data.answer: They provide structural stability and inflexibility to the host lattice and favor a relatively abrupt spin-crossover transition.

data.question: True or False: The presence of guest molecules significantly influences the coordination environment of the iron(II) crossover centers.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the significance of the diol functional groups on the ligand in A·{ac}?
data.answer: They play an integral role in providing structural stability and inflexibility to the host lattice.

data.question: How does the spin-crossover transition temperature change with the removal of guest molecules?
data.answer: There is a slight decrease in the transition temperature with the removal of guest molecules.

data.question: True or False: The guest acetone molecules are disordered but could be located and refined structurally.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the effect of the spin transition on the pore dimensions of A·{ac}?
data.answer: There is a decrease in the pore dimensions from 14.5 ; 14.5 to 14.2 ; 14.2 =2.

data.question: True or False: The spin-crossover transition in A·{ac} is less abrupt than in isotopological azpy- and tvp-bridged frameworks.
data.answer: False

data.question: What method was used to grow crystals of A·{ac}?
data.answer: Slow diffusion of a solution of bpbd in acetone with a solution of Fe(ClO4)2·H2O and NH4NCS in acetone in an H-shaped vessel.

data.question: True or False: The structural stability to desolvation in A·{ac} is attributed to the absence of extensive interframework hydrogen-bonding network.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the result of magnetic susceptibility measurements of A·{ac}?
data.answer: A relatively abrupt one-step full spin transition with T1/2 = 162 K.

data.question: True or False: The solvent-accessible void volume increases from 27.3 to 25.1% of the crystal volume after the spin transition.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the purpose of the experimental section described in the text?
data.answer: To provide details on the synthesis and characterization of the nanoporous iron(II) coordination framework material, A·{ac}.
